com.apriori.collections

Interface ConcurrentSets.Builder<E,T extends Set<E>>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of element in the returned set
    T - the type of set (e.g. Set, SortedSet, or NavigableSet)
    Enclosing class:
    ConcurrentSets

    public static interface ConcurrentSets.Builder<E,T extends Set<E>>
    Creates concurrent set objects using the builder pattern.

    Example usage: 

     // return a concurrent set that is based on a
 // HashSet and uses default parameters of 10
 // concurrent writer threads and unfair locks.
 return ConcurrentSets.withSet(new HashSet()).create();
 
 // return a concurrent sorted set that is based on a
 // TreeSet, expects 5 concurrent writer threads,
 // and uses fair locks.
 return ConcurrentSets.withSet(new TreeSet())
                      .concurrency(5)
                      .fair(true)
                      .create();
    Author:
    Joshua Humphries (jhumphries131@gmail.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConcurrentSets.Builder<E,T> concurrency(int concurrency)
      Sets the concurrency level for the set that will be created.
      T create()
      Creates a set.
      ConcurrentSets.Builder<E,T> fair(boolean fair)
      Sets whether or not access to the set uses fair read-write locks.

    • Method Detail

      • concurrency

        ConcurrentSets.Builder<E,T> concurrency(int concurrency)
        Sets the concurrency level for the set that will be created. If this method is never called, the created set will use ConcurrentSets.DEFAULT_CONCURRENCY.
        Parameters:
        concurrency - the level of concurrency
        Returns:
        this

      • fair

        ConcurrentSets.Builder<E,T> fair(boolean fair)
        Sets whether or not access to the set uses fair read-write locks. If this method is never called, the created set will not use fair locks.
        Parameters:
        fair - whether or not to use fair locks
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        ReentrantReadWriteLock

      • create

        T create()
        Creates a set.
        Returns:
        the concurrent set
